rules_summary: Grab attention in the first 2-3 seconds with a dynamic visual or unexpected element.
Prompt user curiosity immediately by asking a question or presenting a teaser.
Front-load important information; introduce your value proposition within the first 5 seconds.
Employ text overlays to convey core messages, especially when audio may be muted by default.
Use fast pacing with multiple cuts to maintain engagement; aim for changes every 3-4 seconds.
Keep video content under 15 seconds for optimal performance across social platforms.
Ensure content is visually captivating without sound, using captions and expressive visuals.
Utilize rhythm changes to focus viewer attention on critical parts of the message.
Consider platform-specific optimizations, such as vertical formats for mobile-centric apps.
Combine tight shots with a mixture of wide shots for a dynamic feel.
Adapt soundtrack and visuals to reflect energy shifts and emotional tone.
Highlight the call-to-action clearly early and late in the video sequence.
three_three_three_definition: Change visual elements every 3 seconds to maintain viewer interest.
Refresh text overlays at least every 3 seconds to reinforce key points and keep text dynamic.
Alter timing or rhythm of cuts approximately every 3 seconds, matching music if used.
Use a visual or auditory 'stinger' every 3 seconds to anchor attention.
Synchronize video elements like motion graphics or animations at 3-second intervals.
Incorporate new information at 3-second points to build narrative structure.
Employ subtle shifts in color grading or lighting to signal changes every 3 seconds.
Explore rotating between different types of shots (e.g., close-ups, mediums, wide).
Adjust pacing by introducing mini-climaxes or reveals every 3 seconds.
Maintain high energy through consistent motion or movement cues.
hook_0_2_rule: Capture viewer attention during the very first second with an eye-catching visual.
Pose a provocative question or scenario immediately to spark interest.
Utilize a strong, high-energy opening sound to draw attention instantly.
Present a clear and concise value proposition within 2 seconds.
Include unexpected elements (e.g., humor, surprise) right from the start to halt scrolling.
Start with compelling action or motion to instantly engage viewers.
Make sure brand elements are visible right away if branding is crucial.
Optimize the thumbnail and opening frame to be visually appealing even on silent autoplay.
pacing_editing_rules: Utilize rapid cuts to create dynamic flow, especially in short-form ads.
Synchronize visual pacing with music beats for enhanced engagement.
Ensure narrative coherence despite fast cuts by maintaining a logical sequence.
Apply motion tracking or stabilization to enhance visual fluidity.
Switch perspectives frequently to prevent visual monotony.
Lengthen pause after impactful statements to let them resonate.
Layer in graphics or text dynamically to keep up with quick pacing.
Alternate between different scales of shots to create depth.
Maintain rhythm through consistent tempo shifts in editing.
Consider cross-cutting techniques to weave multiple storylines.
Balance speed with clarity, ensuring messages are easily understood even at rapid pace.
Use rhythmic patterns in both visuals and audio to enhance memory retention.
Experiment with jump cuts to indicate time progression efficiently.
Integrate slow-motion shots strategically to highlight important details.
